ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Mostly lagrangian mechanics, with a lot of Hamiltonian mechanics squeezed into the last two weeks.
Yes I would recommend this course.
Excellent course, take it if you have time! The discussion of hamiltonian dynamics and their relation to quantum mechanics was especially interesting!

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: The portions of this most relevant to my research specifically were Lagrangian and Hamiltonian dynamics. While Lagrangians were covered very well, Hamiltonian dynamics, which came at the end of the semester, felt rushed. In terms of direct usefulness, I would rather have spent more time on that material and less time on, for example, central forces or rigid body motion.
